**The Jade Canon and Precious Instructions of the Supreme Clarity Purple Tenuity Emperor Lord and the South Pole Primordial Sovereign**

**Canon Title:** *The Jade Canon and Precious Instructions of the Supreme Clarity Purple Tenuity Emperor Lord and the South Pole Primordial Sovereign*. Author unknown, approximately dating to the Northern and Southern Dynasties. Contains two texts: *The Twenty-Four Divine Perfected Ones of the Supreme Tenuity Emperor Lord’s Scripture of the Return to the Origin* and *The Jade Canon and Precious Instructions of the South Pole Primordial Sovereign*. One scroll. Source text: *Daoist Canon of the Zhengtong Era*, *Cavern Mystery Section*, *Jade Instructions Category*.

---

**The Jade Canon and Precious Instructions of the Supreme Clarity Purple Tenuity Emperor Lord and the South Pole Primordial Sovereign**

The Supreme Tenuity Emperor Lord, formed by the Great One, the inner spirits of the Purple Origin, and the Twenty-Four Perfected Ones, arises from the intermingling of qi, governing the essence of transcendent ascent. They dissolve the knots of the womb and release obstructions to open the origin. The twenty-four knots and nodes must be commanded by the twenty-four spirits before they can be untied and dispelled.

If one cultivates and visualizes their names, they will govern and stabilize the entire body, preserving the primordial essence. On the day one seeks to dissolve the knots, one must first invoke them to open the gates.

The Purple Numinosity is the profound origin of knotted qi, the true spirits that complete the body. They guide clouds and mist, bearing the true smoke of generation, each capable of summoning jade chariots and dragon-riders, arrayed in the thousands, ascending as one body into the dawn of the white sun. This is the Way of the Supreme Perfected Ones’ twenty-four spirits, the method of preserving the mysterious and guarding the origin, by which one ascends to the Jade Clarity and rides the whirlwind.

One must always settle the body, calm the mind, align the qi, and rectify the form. Closing the eyes to gaze inward, forgetting the body and contemplating the spirits, purifying with ablutions, preserving the spirits and guarding the true—one faintly perceives the threefold entry into the radiant, misty brilliance of the mysterious. Practicing this for eighteen years, the Supreme One commands the Supreme Tenuity Emperor Lord, the Great One, and the Five Spirits to transform and give rise to the Lord of the Mixed Numinous Dao. They summon the Twenty-Four Perfected Ones, accompanied by a thousand chariots and ten thousand riders, treading the wind and traveling the clouds, inhaling the flowing rosy clouds, ascending to heaven in broad daylight.

The Way of preserving the spirits requires avoiding improper associations, retreating into seclusion, nurturing essence and gathering the numinous. With the mind contemplating and the eyes visualizing, subtly guarding the tranquil, calming the hun and settling the form—then the myriad harms will not injure, the hundred ghosts will flee, the thousand demons will not arise, misfortunes will disperse, and calamities will vanish. Its wonders are beyond measure.

First, knock the teeth twenty-four times, then proceed with visualization. The *Divine Regulations of the Precious Scriptures of the Most High* states: The method of knocking the teeth—left against left is called "Breaking the Heavenly Bell"; right against right is called "Striking the Heavenly Chime"; upper and lower center against each other is called "Resounding the Heavenly Drum." If suddenly encountering inauspicious omens or malevolence, one should break the Heavenly Bell ten times. When traversing mountains and repelling evil spirits with mighty invocations, one should strike the Heavenly Chime. When visualizing and invoking the Dao to summon the true and attract the numinous, one should resound the Heavenly Drum.

Though the act of knocking the teeth is singular, in truth, it involves left, right, upper, and lower. Thus, malevolence fears the sound of the Heavenly Bell, mountain spirits are subdued by the resonance of the Heavenly Chime, and the summoning of spirits is solemnized by the thunder of the Heavenly Drum. The mysterious notes have their measures, subtly resonating within; they cannot be sought through careless transmission nor attained by mere chance. Whether in a thousand or ten thousand instances, all must follow this principle—the method of knocking the teeth unfolds, and the sounds of the bell and drum are distinct.

Therefore, the methods of the Dao must not be violated or confused, nor should techniques be mixed or disordered. Violation and confusion lead to obscurity and failure; disorder and chaos result in slander and ruin. It is not that the profound lacks coherence, but that practice lacks proper sequence. The failure of the Dao and the inefficacy of affairs stem from seekers of the true not obtaining the proper method, treading the edge of the path and erring in their approach.

Breaking the Heavenly Bell thirty times refers to performing this alone to dispel inauspiciousness without other invocations. If following a specific practice, one should knock the teeth according to the prescribed number in the text, not necessarily breaking it thirty times.

The brain spirit is named Awakened Origin Lad, styled Dao Capital. Its form is one cun and one fen in length, of pure white color.

The hair spirit is named Mysterious Patterned Florescence, styled Dao Balance. Its form is two cun and three fen in length, of dark color.

The skin spirit is named Universal Uniter, styled Dao Link. Its form is one cun and five fen in length, of yellow color.

The eye spirit is named Numinous Overseer of Life, styled Dao Youth. Its form is two cun and five fen in length, clad in five-colored garments.

The neck marrow spirit is named Numinous Plan Cover, styled Dao Circumference. Its form is five cun and three fen in length, of white color.

The spinal spirit is named Beneficial Sequence Support, styled Dao Pillar. Its form is three cun and five fen in length, clad in plain white jade garments.

The nose spirit is named Central Dragon Jade, styled Dao Subtlety. Its form is two cun and five fen in length, clad in garments of blue, yellow, and white.

The tongue spirit is named Originating Beam Peak, styled Dao Fork. Its form is seven cun in length, clad in red garments.

First, visualize the names of the eight numinous lads of the upper body’s eight luminous spirits, imagining them in infant form, faintly present within the body, each residing in its proper place. Upon completion, knock the teeth eight times, swallow saliva eight times, and softly invoke:

*"The eight spirits of the upper luminous realm unite and enter the body. The Emperor Lord and Mysterious Mother, the Five Spirits each arrayed, lift the form and transform it, flowing and changing to attain the true. A thousand chariots and ten thousand riders together ascend to the imperial dawn. The White Origin and Non-Ultimate guide and nurture the Grand Guest. The eight numinous ones flank the body, jade radiance bearing mist. In ten cycles of vagueness, they pass directly through the gate of the sun."*

At the beginning of visualization, first call the names of the spirits three times, then invoke them. After the invocation, call their names three more times, so that the sound barely leaves the mouth, and the three sections respond in unison. At dawn, midday, and midnight, always visualize the Twenty-Four Spirits in sequence, invoking and calling them as described above.

The throat spirit is named Hundred Streams Released, styled Dao Passage. Its form is eight cun and nine fen in length, of red color.

The lung spirit is named Plain Numinous Life, styled Dao Level. Its form is eight cun and one fen in length, of pure white.

The heart spirit is named Radiant Yang Prosperity, styled Dao Brightness. Its form is nine cun in length, of red color.

The liver spirit is named Opening Lord Lad, styled Dao Azure.

The liver spirit’s form is six cun in length, of azure color.

The gallbladder spirit is named Dragon Virtue Bound, styled Dao Release. Its form is three cun and six fen in length, of azure, yellow, and green color.

The spleen spirit is named Treasure Origin Complete, styled Dao Ascendant. Its form is seven cun and three fen in length, of yellow color.

The left kidney spirit is named Spring Origin Upright, styled Dao Minister. Its form is three cun and seven fen in length, of dark color, shifting between white and red, its five colors inconstant.

The right kidney spirit is named Image Other None, styled Dao Jade. Its form is three cun in length, of white or black color.

Next visualize the Eight Radiant Spirit Youths of the central body, in sequence, each resembling an infant in form, faintly present within the body, each settled in its proper place. When done, knock the teeth eight times, swallow saliva eight times, and softly intone the invocation:

Eight spirits of the central radiance,
Four transformations, nine flights,
Refining the hun-soul, preserving the body,
Bright radiance shares its splendor.
The Lord Emperor unties the knots,
The fetal bonds return to the four directions.
Above, they commune with the Mysterious Mother,
Dispersing numinous power, releasing majesty.
Attaining union with the eight spirits,
Together we ride in shared flight,
A thousand chariots, ten thousand riders,
Ascending to the Grand Tenuity.

The stomach spirit is named Together Come Nurture, styled Dao Unfolding. Its form is seven cun in length, of yellow color.

The spirit within the hollow intestines is named Omen Knee Health, styled Dao Return. Its form is two cun and four fen in length, of yellow-red color.

The spirit within the large and small intestines is named Vast Send Remain, styled Dao Kitchen. Its form is two cun and one fen in length, of red-yellow color.

The spirit within the torso is named Receive Abundance Vigorous, styled Dao Void. Its form is nine cun and one fen in length, clad in nine-colored robes.

The spirit of the chest diaphragm is named Vast Crystal Abode, styled Dao Surge. Its form is five cun in length, of white color.

The two flank spirits are named Ward Off False Horse, styled Dao Accomplished. Their form is four cun and one fen in length, of red-white color.

The left yin and left yang spirit is named Support Flow Rise, styled Dao Jade Tablet. Its form is two cun and three fen in length, of azure, yellow, and white color. In men, visualize it as the left yang; in women, as the left yin.

The right yin and right yang spirit is named Embrace Manifest Brightness, styled Dao Life. Its form is two cun and three fen in length, of azure, yellow, and white color. In men, visualize it as the right yang; in women, as the right yin.

Next visualize the Eight Radiant Spirit Youths of the lower body, in sequence, each resembling an infant in form, faintly present within the body, each settled in its proper place. When done, knock the teeth eight times, swallow saliva eight times, and softly intone the invocation:

Eight spirits of the lower radiance,
Dispersed forms transform into numinous power,
Purple mist rises thickly,
Containing origin, guarding essence.
The Great One, Primordial Father,
The Lord Emperor engenders life.
Seven flowers reflect the register,
The Controller of Destiny records the numinous.
Hun and po are at peace,
Five flowers nurture brightness.
A thousand chariots, ten thousand riders,
Together with me they advance,
First to the Grand Simplicity,
Then to salute the Highest Clarity.

The inner spirit of the Dao Unity is named Escape None Horse, styled Dao Ultimate Life. Its form is two cun and two fen in length, of purple color. In men, it is visualized as the inner spirit of the Dao Unity; in women, as the central numen of the True Origin.

This is the profound spirit of the body’s utmost root, the supreme numen guarding the center. Next visualize it in the form of an infant, seated peacefully in its place.

When finished, knock the teeth thirty times, swallow saliva twenty-four cycles, and softly intone the incantation:

"Dark Prime’s inner truth,
Nurtures form to serve the dawn,
Mastering the web and its guiding threads,
Nine revolutions, eight spirals,
Outer stars arrayed in ranks,
Inner halls arrayed in ninefold rows,
The Lord Emperor joins in flourishing,
Nine Ways, seven swallows,
Essence flows forth, inner essence refined,
Harmonizing to bathe the host of spirits,
The five viscera bloom with radiance,
Reversing age to a child’s face,
A thousand chariots, ten thousand riders,
Ascend with me to heaven,
To pay court at the Grand Steps,
To bow deeply to Jade Dawn."

This is the precious inner name of the body, the spirit of transformation and life. Without knowing this name, the immortal Way cannot be achieved. If on the day of untying the knots one does not first recite this incantation, the knots will not be undone. Should the knots remain unloosed, the three *hun* will lose their proper state, the Upper Prime’s inner power will be lost, the Five Elders will lose their clarity, and the Lord Emperor will become distant. In men, visualize it as the spirit of a male child; in women, as the spirit of a female child—both share the same name. Visualize the twenty-four spirits: always at midnight, remove the pillow and lie flat, clasp the hands firmly, relax the body, and regulate the breath until it is subtle. Compose the body’s spirits in thought, settle the mind on the Lord Emperor, and cause him to seem as if present in his place. Close the eyes and inwardly behold him. If any are not fully present, then burn incense, sit upright with eyes closed, clasp the hands over the knees, and with focused intent recite the incantations as prescribed. At dawn and midday, visualize the spirits while sitting upright, ensuring no one sees you—always inwardly behold with eyes closed.

On the first day of the month at midnight, after visualizing the spirits, next visualize within the two eyes a white *qi* the size of a chicken’s egg, suspended before the face. After a moment, it transforms into two luminous mirrors, nine inches in diameter, which shine before and behind, illuminating the twenty-four spirits upon the body with perfect clarity. After a long while, intone the incantation:

"Great Bright Treasure Mirror,
Dispersing forms and transforming,
Illumining the primordial spirit,
Subduing the ten thousand demons,
Soaring to fly in the Upper Clarity,
Parting the clouds and celestial gauze,
Commanding the myriad spirits,
Sealing mountains and summoning rivers."

When finished, practice this once every five days. This is what is meant by "enveloping and embracing inner essence, gathering and restraining the five spirits." By practicing this constantly, calamities will not arise, and one will ascend to the rank of high immortal.

The method of the "Brushing Child" enables one to clearly behold the Lord Emperor’s five spirits and the twenty-four spirits. Always on the *jiazi* day of the旬, the *gengwu* day, at noon, take one *sheng* of pure water and add one *zhu* of true cinnabar. Stir it counterclockwise twenty-one times and intone the incantation:

"Mysterious Flow of Vermilion Nectar,
Generating the eightfold brilliance,
The body’s spirits arrayed in ranks,
All come to manifest their forms,
Piercing vision for ten thousand *li*,
Penetrating the nine numina,
The Lord Emperor illumines the child,
Enabling my supreme essence."

When finished, face east and wash the eyes with the water fourteen times. Those who practice this constantly will clearly behold the myriad spirits. The incantation should be softly spoken, with the water directed toward the moon’s position.

**The Supreme Perfected’s Inner Record of Divine Immortals**
**The Supreme Perfected’s Secret Method for Summoning the Five Celestial Bodies and Flying *Hun* in the Grotto Chamber and Six Harmonies**

The Supreme Perfected summons the five celestial bodies in the Grotto Chamber and registers the flying *hun* in the Six Harmonies’ hidden store of secret methods. From the *Jade Canon of the Numinous Essentials of the Southern Culmen*, the precious method:

At midnight, in stillness, sit or lie as you wish. Calm the body, purify the heart, relax the breath, and harmonize the spirit. Close the eyes and inwardly visualize: in the west, the Great White Star, positioned above the two eyebrows, called Jade Pendants of the Purple Palace. One *cun* above the eyebrows and one *cun* inward is the Jade Pendants of the Purple Palace. On yang days, visualize the star above the left eyebrow; on yin days, above the right eyebrow.

Next, visualize the north’s Celestial Body Star in the Heavenly Center’s Imperial Realm of the Dark Palace. The Imperial Realm of the Dark Palace is five *fen* straight up from the nose to the hairline, then one *cun* inward.

Next, visualize the east’s Wood Star in the Vermilion Terrace of the Grotto Pass. The Vermilion Terrace of the Grotto Pass is one *cun* behind the eyes and one *cun* inward. On yang days, visualize the star behind the left eye; on yin days, behind the right eye.

Next, visualize the south’s Sparkling Deluder Star in the Flowery Chamber of the Jade Gate. The Flowery Chamber of the Jade Gate is five *fen* inward from the inner canthi of the two eyes. On yang days, visualize the star at the left eye’s canthus; on yin days, at the right eye’s canthus.

Next, visualize the center’s Quelling Star in the Yellow Chamber of the Golden Coffer and Long Valley. The Yellow Chamber of the Golden Coffer and Long Valley is two *fen* straight inward from the center of the philtrum. The star seems suspended above.

When the visualization is complete, cause the stars to seem as if occupying their positions. One should feel the five stars emitting rays of light, releasing five-colored mists that penetrate the entire body, inside and out, as if dark star-essences are entering within.

Then knock the teeth five times, swallow saliva twenty-five cycles, and softly intone the incantation:

"Lofty Purple Palace,
Within behold the Lord Emperor,
Great One in primordial union,
Gate of the Purple Chamber,
Within the gate, radiant brightness,
This is the Three Primes,
The Three Primes conjoin essence,
Thus arise the five spirits,
Precious luminaries spread their splendor,
Emitting light to guard the dawn,
Essence transforms and accumulates,
Changing into an elder,
Head crowned with a plain cap,
Green mantle, crimson skirt,
Right side bearing flowing bells,
Left side girded with the Tiger’s Might,
Hand grasping Heaven’s Steel,
Dispersing blades to fly the celestial bodies,
Feet treading the flowery canopy,
Spewing rays to refine the body,
The Three Effulgences guard and protect,
Enabling me to attain the true,
Nurturing the *po*, restraining the *hun*,
Riding the whirlwind to fly as an immortal."

When finished, swallow saliva three more times and knock the teeth three times.

Those who can practice this method for fifteen years will be met by the Southern Culmen’s Elder of Cinnabar Mound, the Upper Perfected, who will welcome them with a chariot of green clouds; the Western Culmen’s Elder of Plain Clouds, the Master of the Appointed Time, who will welcome them with a carriage of yellow whirlwinds; the Northern Culmen’s Elder of the Dark Prime, the Celestial Sovereign, who will welcome them with a dragon of dark effulgence; the Eastern Culmen’s Elder, the Duke Who Upholds Yang, who will welcome them with a retinue of azure chariots; and the Central Prime’s Elder, the Supreme Dark Child of the Center, who will welcome them with a canopy of curved dawn. The Five Elders will unite and together ascend to the Purple Void.

Practice this without fail, and visualize with precision.

Avoid treading upon filth, refrain from mingling with the impure, regularly burn incense, and bathe frequently. Those who violate these precepts will wither and decay; those who observe them will ascend as flying immortals.

Once the visualization of the stars is complete and you harbor a wish, express it immediately after your prayer. Envision the Five Stars dwelling together, entering two *cun* below the nape and spreading one *cun* in each direction, each star like a pellet illuminating the body through and through.

On the first, fifteenth, seventh, ninth, thirteenth, seventeenth, twentieth, and twenty-fifth days of the lunar month, at cock’s crow, visualize the images of the sun and moon within the *Hun Chamber of the Six Harmonies*. The *Hun Chamber of the Six Harmonies* lies in the small upward curve above the outer corners of the eyes, within the high void. Press upon it, click the teeth, and listen below—where the four convergences stir beneath is the location. It extends one *cun* inward and spans nine *fen* in width, known as the *Mansion of the Hun Chamber of the Six Harmonies*.

With the sun on the left and the moon on the right, visualize their radiance penetrating the form, ensuring their faint presence in position. Open the eyes and concentrate intensely, allowing no lapse. Upon completion, click the teeth seven times and softly intone:

*"O Radiant Dawn of the Great Clarity,
Ninefold verdant mist ascends,
Summoning rosy clouds to conceal their splendor,
Bathing and refining the Five Forms.
The palace chariot of the Six Harmonies,
The seven spirits in harmonious balance—
Let me ascend as a flying immortal,
My hun-soul mounting the Upper Clarity."*

Practice this for fifteen years, and the Jade Emperor will dispatch the *Three Simplicity Chariots* to welcome you. You must train the cock to crow, ensuring it governs the dawn with regularity. Should you conceal the script and practice in secret, you will surely lose the intertwined radiance of the sun and moon.

The Southern Culmen Lady received this method from the Supreme Lofty Perfected, naming it *The Hidden Way of Dual Radiance and Winged Form*. Only those with true immortal bones may behold this scripture.

Face east toward the *Great Clarity, Primordial Origin, Upper Three Heavens, Boundless Great Dao, and the Venerable Lords of the Multitudes*. Face west toward the *Celestial Masters, Female Masters, Heir Masters, and Lineage Masters—the Three Master Lords*. Face north toward the *Supreme Lord Lao, Supreme Mystery Upper First Lord, and Supreme Venerable Lord*. Face south toward the *Lord of Virtue and the Venerable Lord of Virtue, Lord of Myriad Blessings and the Venerable Lord of Myriad Blessings, Lord of Myriad Lives and the Venerable Lord of Myriad Lives*.

Here ends the *Jade Scripture Precious Formulae of the Upper Clarity Purple Tenuity Emperor and the Southern Culmen Primordial Lord*.

chunks.original_text: 上清紫微帝君南极元君玉经宝诀 经名：上清紫彻帝君南极元君玉经宝诀。 撰人不评，约出於南北朝。 内载《太微帝君二十四神迥元经》、《南极元君玉经宝诀》二篇。 一卷。 底本出处：《正统道藏》洞玄部玉诀类。 上清紫微帝君南极元君玉经宝诀 太微帝君，太一造形，紫元内神、二十四真人，混气变生，主仙上精，散解胞结，释滞开元。 二十四结节，须二十四神所命，乃得除脱也。 兆能修存名字者，则治镇一身，保守元精。 欲解节结之日，当先祝之，乃得开关耳。 紫灵并是结气之玄宗，成体之真神、运导云雾，带生真烟，各能致玉辇龙骑，千万列行，同与一体，白日登晨。 此太上真人二十四神存玄守元帝君上生玉清乘飙之道。 常当安身静一心，正气夷形，闭目内视，忘体念神，烧乱盥漱，存神守真，仿髴三入蔼蔼晖玄。 行之十八年，太上命太微帝君太一五神，化生混灵道君，邀二十四真人，千乘‘万骑，风蹑云行，呼吸流霞，白日造天。 存神之道，勿一交非类，深室避事，栖精摄灵，心存目想，微妙守冲，静魂安形，则万害不伤，百鬼避窜，千妖不行，消殃散祸，妙不可胜。 先叩齿二十四通，毕乃存思。 高上宝书神明科经说曰：叩齿之法，左左相叩，名曰折制天钟； 右右相叩，名曰震椎天磬； 中央上下对相叩，名曰呜严天鼓。 若卒遇凶恶不祥，当折天钟主十过。 若经山，辟邪威神大祝，当椎天磬。 存思念道，致真招灵，当呜天鼓。 叩齿虽一，其实有左右上下也。 故凶恶而畏天钟之响，山神而摄天磬之洞，招神而肃天鼓之震矣。 玄商有节，希微内感，不可以付而求，不可偶然而古也。 千章万章，皆当如此，叩齿之道演矣，钟鼓之音别也。 是以道数不可乖错，术法不可杂乱。 乖错则有暗昧之败，杂乱财有讟毁之桥，非冥冥之无贯也，行冥贯之无序耳。 道之不成，事之不验，良由求真之徒不得法也，履边辙之，造而多愆乎。 折天钟三十通，谓无他祝，孤行此以除不祥耳。 若有所按行，随本文叩齿之多少，不必须折三十通也。 脑神名觉元子，字道都。 形长一寸一分，色正白。 发神名玄文华，字道衡。 形长二寸三分，色玄。 皮肤神名通众仲，字道连。 形长一寸五分，色黄。 目神名灵监生，字道童。 形长二寸五分，衣五色衣。 项髓神名灵谟盖，字道周。 形长五寸三分，色白。 膂神名益历辅，字道柱。 形长三寸五分，白玉素衣。 鼻神名仲龙玉，字道微。 形长二寸五分，青黄白色衣。 舌神名始梁峙，字道岐。 形长七寸，衣赤衣。 右存一身上部八景神童名字，先存之，并婴儿之形，仿髴在身，各安其所。 讫，乃叩齿八通，咽液八过，而微祝曰： 上景八神，一合入身，帝君玄母，五神各陈，举形遂化，流变适真，千乘万骑，俱升帝晨，白元无英，导养太宾，八灵翼体，玉华衔烟，恍惚十周，径造日门。 初存思之始，先三呼神名字，祝讫，又三呼神名字，令声才出口，三部同尔。 平旦、日中、夜半三时，恒存二十四神，以次念之，祝呼如上法。 喉神名百流放，字道通。 形长八寸九分，色赤。 肺神名素灵生，字道平。 形长八寸一分，纯白。 心神名焕阳昌，字道明。 形长九寸，色赤。 肝神名开君童，字道青。

They guide clouds and mist, bearing the true smoke of generation, each capable of summoning jade chariots and dragon-riders, arrayed in the thousands, ascending as one body into the dawn of the white sun. This is the Way of the Supreme Perfected Ones’ twenty-four spirits, the method of preserving the mysterious and guarding the origin, by which one ascends to the Jade Clarity and rides the whirlwind.

One must always settle the body, calm the mind, align the qi, and rectify the form. Closing the eyes to gaze inward, forgetting the body and contemplating the spirits, purifying with ablutions, preserving the spirits and guarding the true—one faintly perceives the threefold entry into the radiant, misty brilliance of the mysterious. Practicing this for eighteen years, the Supreme One commands the Supreme Tenuity Emperor Lord, the Great One, and the Five Spirits to transform and give rise to the Lord of the Mixed Numinous Dao. They summon the Twenty-Four Perfected Ones, accompanied by a thousand chariots and ten thousand riders, treading the wind and traveling the clouds, inhaling the flowing rosy clouds, ascending to heaven in broad daylight.

The Way of preserving the spirits requires avoiding improper associations, retreating into seclusion, nurturing essence and gathering the numinous. With the mind contemplating and the eyes visualizing, subtly guarding the tranquil, calming the hun and settling the form—then the myriad harms will not injure, the hundred ghosts will flee, the thousand demons will not arise, misfortunes will disperse, and calamities will vanish. Its wonders are beyond measure.

First, knock the teeth twenty-four times, then proceed with visualization. The *Divine Regulations of the Precious Scriptures of the Most High* states: The method of knocking the teeth—left against left is called "Breaking the Heavenly Bell"; right against right is called "Striking the Heavenly Chime"; upper and lower center against each other is called "Resounding the Heavenly Drum." If suddenly encountering inauspicious omens or malevolence, one should break the Heavenly Bell ten times. When traversing mountains and repelling evil spirits with mighty invocations, one should strike the Heavenly Chime. When visualizing and invoking the Dao to summon the true and attract the numinous, one should resound the Heavenly Drum.

Though the act of knocking the teeth is singular, in truth, it involves left, right, upper, and lower. Thus, malevolence fears the sound of the Heavenly Bell, mountain spirits are subdued by the resonance of the Heavenly Chime, and the summoning of spirits is solemnized by the thunder of the Heavenly Drum. The mysterious notes have their measures, subtly resonating within; they cannot be sought through careless transmission nor attained by mere chance. Whether in a thousand or ten thousand instances, all must follow this principle—the method of knocking the teeth unfolds, and the sounds of the bell and drum are distinct.

Therefore, the methods of the Dao must not be violated or confused, nor should techniques be mixed or disordered. Violation and confusion lead to obscurity and failure; disorder and chaos result in slander and ruin. It is not that the profound lacks coherence, but that practice lacks proper sequence. The failure of the Dao and the inefficacy of affairs stem from seekers of the true not obtaining the proper method, treading the edge of the path and erring in their approach.

Breaking the Heavenly Bell thirty times refers to performing this alone to dispel inauspiciousness without other invocations. If following a specific practice, one should knock the teeth according to the prescribed number in the text, not necessarily breaking it thirty times.

The brain spirit is named Awakened Origin Lad, styled Dao Capital. Its form is one cun and one fen in length, of pure white color.

The hair spirit is named Mysterious Patterned Florescence, styled Dao Balance. Its form is two cun and three fen in length, of dark color.

The skin spirit is named Universal Uniter, styled Dao Link. Its form is one cun and five fen in length, of yellow color.

The eye spirit is named Numinous Overseer of Life, styled Dao Youth. Its form is two cun and five fen in length, clad in five-colored garments.

The neck marrow spirit is named Numinous Plan Cover, styled Dao Circumference. Its form is five cun and three fen in length, of white color.

The spinal spirit is named Beneficial Sequence Support, styled Dao Pillar. Its form is three cun and five fen in length, clad in plain white jade garments.

The nose spirit is named Central Dragon Jade, styled Dao Subtlety. Its form is two cun and five fen in length, clad in garments of blue, yellow, and white.

The tongue spirit is named Originating Beam Peak, styled Dao Fork. Its form is seven cun in length, clad in red garments.

First, visualize the names of the eight numinous lads of the upper body’s eight luminous spirits, imagining them in infant form, faintly present within the body, each residing in its proper place. Upon completion, knock the teeth eight times, swallow saliva eight times, and softly invoke:

*"The eight spirits of the upper luminous realm unite and enter the body. The Emperor Lord and Mysterious Mother, the Five Spirits each arrayed, lift the form and transform it, flowing and changing to attain the true. A thousand chariots and ten thousand riders together ascend to the imperial dawn. The White Origin and Non-Ultimate guide and nurture the Grand Guest. The eight numinous ones flank the body, jade radiance bearing mist. In ten cycles of vagueness, they pass directly through the gate of the sun."*

At the beginning of visualization, first call the names of the spirits three times, then invoke them. After the invocation, call their names three more times, so that the sound barely leaves the mouth, and the three sections respond in unison. At dawn, midday, and midnight, always visualize the Twenty-Four Spirits in sequence, invoking and calling them as described above.

The throat spirit is named Hundred Streams Released, styled Dao Passage. Its form is eight cun and nine fen in length, of red color.

The lung spirit is named Plain Numinous Life, styled Dao Level. Its form is eight cun and one fen in length, of pure white.

The heart spirit is named Radiant Yang Prosperity, styled Dao Brightness. Its form is nine cun in length, of red color.

The liver spirit is named Opening Lord Lad, styled Dao Azure.

chunks.original_text: 形长六寸，青色。 胆神名龙德拘，字道放。 形长三寸六分，青黄绿色。 脾神名宝元全，字道骞。 形长七寸三分，黄色。 左肾神名春元直，字道卿。 形长三寸七分，色玄，数变白赤，五色无常。 右肾神名象他无，字道玉。 形长三寸，色白或黑。 右存一身中部八景神童名字，次存之，并如婴儿之形，仿髴在身，各安其所。 讫，叩齿八通，咽液八过，而微祝曰： 中景八神，四变九飞，炼魂保身，明景同晖，帝君解结，胎缚四归，上通玄母，散灵出威，得与八神，合辇齐飞，千乘万骑，上登太微。 胃神名同来育，字道展。 形长七寸，色黄。 穷肠中神名兆滕康，字道还。 形长二寸四分，黄赤色。 大小肠中神名蓬送留，字道厨。 形长二寸一分，色赤黄。 胴中神名受厚勃，字道虚。 形长九寸一分，九色衣。 胸膈神名广瑛宅，字道冲。 形长五寸，色白。 两胁神名辟假马，字道成。 形长四寸一分，色赤白。 左阴左阳神，名扶流起，字道圭。 形长二寸三分，色青黄白，在男存为左阳，女存为左阴。 右阴右阳神，名苞表明，字道生。 形长二寸三分，色青黄白，在男存为右阳，女存为右阴。 右存一身下部八景神童名字，后存之，并婴儿之形，仿髴在身，各安其所。 讫，乃叩齿八通，咽液八过，而微祝曰： 下景八神，散形化灵，紫烟郁生，含元守精，太一元父，帝君挺生，七华映籍，司命记灵，魂魄以安，五华育明，千乘万骑，与我同并，先造太素，次揖上清。 道一内神，名遁无马，字道极生。 形长二寸二分，紫色。 男存曰道一内神，女存曰真元中灵。 右一身极根之幽神，守中之上灵也。 次又存之，如婴儿之状，安坐其所。
chunks.translated_text:
The liver spirit’s form is six cun in length, of azure color.

The gallbladder spirit is named Dragon Virtue Bound, styled Dao Release. Its form is three cun and six fen in length, of azure, yellow, and green color.

The spleen spirit is named Treasure Origin Complete, styled Dao Ascendant. Its form is seven cun and three fen in length, of yellow color.

The left kidney spirit is named Spring Origin Upright, styled Dao Minister. Its form is three cun and seven fen in length, of dark color, shifting between white and red, its five colors inconstant.

The right kidney spirit is named Image Other None, styled Dao Jade. Its form is three cun in length, of white or black color.

Next visualize the Eight Radiant Spirit Youths of the central body, in sequence, each resembling an infant in form, faintly present within the body, each settled in its proper place. When done, knock the teeth eight times, swallow saliva eight times, and softly intone the invocation:

Eight spirits of the central radiance,
Four transformations, nine flights,
Refining the hun-soul, preserving the body,
Bright radiance shares its splendor.
The Lord Emperor unties the knots,
The fetal bonds return to the four directions.
Above, they commune with the Mysterious Mother,
Dispersing numinous power, releasing majesty.
Attaining union with the eight spirits,
Together we ride in shared flight,
A thousand chariots, ten thousand riders,
Ascending to the Grand Tenuity.

The stomach spirit is named Together Come Nurture, styled Dao Unfolding. Its form is seven cun in length, of yellow color.

The spirit within the hollow intestines is named Omen Knee Health, styled Dao Return. Its form is two cun and four fen in length, of yellow-red color.

The spirit within the large and small intestines is named Vast Send Remain, styled Dao Kitchen. Its form is two cun and one fen in length, of red-yellow color.

The spirit within the torso is named Receive Abundance Vigorous, styled Dao Void. Its form is nine cun and one fen in length, clad in nine-colored robes.

The spirit of the chest diaphragm is named Vast Crystal Abode, styled Dao Surge. Its form is five cun in length, of white color.

The two flank spirits are named Ward Off False Horse, styled Dao Accomplished. Their form is four cun and one fen in length, of red-white color.

The left yin and left yang spirit is named Support Flow Rise, styled Dao Jade Tablet. Its form is two cun and three fen in length, of azure, yellow, and white color. In men, visualize it as the left yang; in women, as the left yin.

The right yin and right yang spirit is named Embrace Manifest Brightness, styled Dao Life. Its form is two cun and three fen in length, of azure, yellow, and white color. In men, visualize it as the right yang; in women, as the right yin.

Next visualize the Eight Radiant Spirit Youths of the lower body, in sequence, each resembling an infant in form, faintly present within the body, each settled in its proper place. When done, knock the teeth eight times, swallow saliva eight times, and softly intone the invocation:

Eight spirits of the lower radiance,
Dispersed forms transform into numinous power,
Purple mist rises thickly,
Containing origin, guarding essence.
The Great One, Primordial Father,
The Lord Emperor engenders life.
Seven flowers reflect the register,
The Controller of Destiny records the numinous.
Hun and po are at peace,
Five flowers nurture brightness.
A thousand chariots, ten thousand riders,
Together with me they advance,
First to the Grand Simplicity,
Then to salute the Highest Clarity.

The inner spirit of the Dao Unity is named Escape None Horse, styled Dao Ultimate Life. Its form is two cun and two fen in length, of purple color. In men, it is visualized as the inner spirit of the Dao Unity; in women, as the central numen of the True Origin.

This is the profound spirit of the body’s utmost root, the supreme numen guarding the center. Next visualize it in the form of an infant, seated peacefully in its place.

chunks.original_text: 讫，乃叩齿三十过，咽液二十四通，而微祝曰： 玄上内真，养形侍晨，总纽摄纲，九度八旋，外星布列，内馆九陈，帝君合昌，九道七咽，出液内精，和灌众神，五脏生华，反老童颜，千乘万骑，与我升天，上朝太陛，高揖玉晨。 右一身宝名内字，化生之精神也。 不知此名，则仙道不成矣。 若解结之日，不先祝此者，则结节不解也。 必结节不解，三魂失适，上元内丧，五老失明，帝君乖踈也。 男存为男童子之神，女存为女童子之神，俱同一名字也。 存二十四神，常以夜半去枕平卧，握固放体，气调而微者，思具身神，安念帝君，令仿髴居位，闭目内视之。 如有不具，便当烧香，平坐闭目，握固两膝上，精存众祝行如法。 其平旦、中时存神，自平坐而行之，勿令有见之者矣，皆内视临闭而存也。 月一日夜半，存神讫，又存两目中有白气，如鸡子大，在面目前，须臾变成两明镜，径九寸，以前后照我一体上二十四神，使洞鉴分明，良久，心祝曰： 大明宝镜，分形散化，鉴朗元神，制却万魔，飞行上清，披云巾罗，役使万灵，封山召河。 毕。 五日一行之。 所谓覆挟内精，检敛五神者也。 常能行之，灾害不生，而位登高仙。 拂童之道，使彻见帝君五神，及二十四神之法。 常以甲子之旬，庚午之日，日中之时，取清水一升，以一铢真丹，投水中搅之，左行三七过，祝曰： 玄流朱津，生光八明，身神众列，并来见形，彻视万里，中达九灵，帝君映童，使我上精。 祝毕，东向以水洗目二七过。 恒行之者，彻见万神。 祝当微言，以水向月建。 太虚真人神仙内记太上真人招五辰飞魂洞房六合隐存宝诀 太上真人招五辰於洞房，籍飞魂於六合隐存秘道，南极元君玉经宝诀。 夜半清静，坐卧任意，安体清心，宽气调神，临目内视，存西方太白星在面两眉上，名为玉珰紫阙。 眉上一寸直入一寸，为玉珰紫阙。 阳日存星在左眉上，阴日存星在右眉上。 次存北方辰星在天中帝乡玄宫。 帝乡玄宫从鼻直上，而至发际五分，直入一寸。 次存东方木星在洞关朱台。 洞关朱台在目后一寸直入一寸，阳日存星在左目后，阴日存星在右目后。 次存南方荧惑星在玉门华房。 玉门华房在两目内眦际五分直入五分，阳日存星在左目眦际，阴日存星在右目眦际。 次存中央镇星在金匮黄室长谷。 金匮黄室长谷，在人中中央直入二分，星如缀悬於上。 存思都讫，仿髴令星处其位，当觉使五星出光芒，放五色烟，贯我一身，洞彻内外，体中如有黑黑星精来入也。 乃叩齿五通，咽液二十五过讫，乃微祝曰： 高上紫阙，内见帝君，太一混合，紫房之门，门内焕明，是为三元，三元结精，乃有五神，宝曜敷晖，放光卫晨，精化积生，变为老人，首建素冠，绿帔绛裙，右带流铃，左佩虎贲，手把天刚，散锋飞辰，足蹑华盖，吐芒炼身，三景保守，令我得真，养魄制魂，乘飙飞仙。 毕，又咽液三过，叩齿三通。 常能行此道十五年者，於是南极老人丹陵上真，迎以绿云之舆； 西极老人素云子期，迎以黄飙之车； 北极老人玄上仙皇，迎以玄景之龙； 东极老人扶阳公子，迎以青軿之辈； 中元老人中央上玄子，迎以曲晨之盖。 五老一合，俱升紫虚。 行之勿令不常也，存之勿令不精也。
chunks.translated_text:
When finished, knock the teeth thirty times, swallow saliva twenty-four cycles, and softly intone the incantation:

"Dark Prime’s inner truth,
Nurtures form to serve the dawn,
Mastering the web and its guiding threads,
Nine revolutions, eight spirals,
Outer stars arrayed in ranks,
Inner halls arrayed in ninefold rows,
The Lord Emperor joins in flourishing,
Nine Ways, seven swallows,
Essence flows forth, inner essence refined,
Harmonizing to bathe the host of spirits,
The five viscera bloom with radiance,
Reversing age to a child’s face,
A thousand chariots, ten thousand riders,
Ascend with me to heaven,
To pay court at the Grand Steps,
To bow deeply to Jade Dawn."

This is the precious inner name of the body, the spirit of transformation and life. Without knowing this name, the immortal Way cannot be achieved. If on the day of untying the knots one does not first recite this incantation, the knots will not be undone. Should the knots remain unloosed, the three *hun* will lose their proper state, the Upper Prime’s inner power will be lost, the Five Elders will lose their clarity, and the Lord Emperor will become distant. In men, visualize it as the spirit of a male child; in women, as the spirit of a female child—both share the same name. Visualize the twenty-four spirits: always at midnight, remove the pillow and lie flat, clasp the hands firmly, relax the body, and regulate the breath until it is subtle. Compose the body’s spirits in thought, settle the mind on the Lord Emperor, and cause him to seem as if present in his place. Close the eyes and inwardly behold him. If any are not fully present, then burn incense, sit upright with eyes closed, clasp the hands over the knees, and with focused intent recite the incantations as prescribed. At dawn and midday, visualize the spirits while sitting upright, ensuring no one sees you—always inwardly behold with eyes closed.

On the first day of the month at midnight, after visualizing the spirits, next visualize within the two eyes a white *qi* the size of a chicken’s egg, suspended before the face. After a moment, it transforms into two luminous mirrors, nine inches in diameter, which shine before and behind, illuminating the twenty-four spirits upon the body with perfect clarity. After a long while, intone the incantation:

"Great Bright Treasure Mirror,
Dispersing forms and transforming,
Illumining the primordial spirit,
Subduing the ten thousand demons,
Soaring to fly in the Upper Clarity,
Parting the clouds and celestial gauze,
Commanding the myriad spirits,
Sealing mountains and summoning rivers."

When finished, practice this once every five days. This is what is meant by "enveloping and embracing inner essence, gathering and restraining the five spirits." By practicing this constantly, calamities will not arise, and one will ascend to the rank of high immortal.

The method of the "Brushing Child" enables one to clearly behold the Lord Emperor’s five spirits and the twenty-four spirits. Always on the *jiazi* day of the旬, the *gengwu* day, at noon, take one *sheng* of pure water and add one *zhu* of true cinnabar. Stir it counterclockwise twenty-one times and intone the incantation:

"Mysterious Flow of Vermilion Nectar,
Generating the eightfold brilliance,
The body’s spirits arrayed in ranks,
All come to manifest their forms,
Piercing vision for ten thousand *li*,
Penetrating the nine numina,
The Lord Emperor illumines the child,
Enabling my supreme essence."

When finished, face east and wash the eyes with the water fourteen times. Those who practice this constantly will clearly behold the myriad spirits. The incantation should be softly spoken, with the water directed toward the moon’s position.

**The Supreme Perfected’s Inner Record of Divine Immortals**
**The Supreme Perfected’s Secret Method for Summoning the Five Celestial Bodies and Flying *Hun* in the Grotto Chamber and Six Harmonies**

The Supreme Perfected summons the five celestial bodies in the Grotto Chamber and registers the flying *hun* in the Six Harmonies’ hidden store of secret methods. From the *Jade Canon of the Numinous Essentials of the Southern Culmen*, the precious method:

At midnight, in stillness, sit or lie as you wish. Calm the body, purify the heart, relax the breath, and harmonize the spirit. Close the eyes and inwardly visualize: in the west, the Great White Star, positioned above the two eyebrows, called Jade Pendants of the Purple Palace. One *cun* above the eyebrows and one *cun* inward is the Jade Pendants of the Purple Palace. On yang days, visualize the star above the left eyebrow; on yin days, above the right eyebrow.

Next, visualize the north’s Celestial Body Star in the Heavenly Center’s Imperial Realm of the Dark Palace. The Imperial Realm of the Dark Palace is five *fen* straight up from the nose to the hairline, then one *cun* inward.

Next, visualize the east’s Wood Star in the Vermilion Terrace of the Grotto Pass. The Vermilion Terrace of the Grotto Pass is one *cun* behind the eyes and one *cun* inward. On yang days, visualize the star behind the left eye; on yin days, behind the right eye.

Next, visualize the south’s Sparkling Deluder Star in the Flowery Chamber of the Jade Gate. The Flowery Chamber of the Jade Gate is five *fen* inward from the inner canthi of the two eyes. On yang days, visualize the star at the left eye’s canthus; on yin days, at the right eye’s canthus.

Next, visualize the center’s Quelling Star in the Yellow Chamber of the Golden Coffer and Long Valley. The Yellow Chamber of the Golden Coffer and Long Valley is two *fen* straight inward from the center of the philtrum. The star seems suspended above.

When the visualization is complete, cause the stars to seem as if occupying their positions. One should feel the five stars emitting rays of light, releasing five-colored mists that penetrate the entire body, inside and out, as if dark star-essences are entering within.

Then knock the teeth five times, swallow saliva twenty-five cycles, and softly intone the incantation:

"Lofty Purple Palace,
Within behold the Lord Emperor,
Great One in primordial union,
Gate of the Purple Chamber,
Within the gate, radiant brightness,
This is the Three Primes,
The Three Primes conjoin essence,
Thus arise the five spirits,
Precious luminaries spread their splendor,
Emitting light to guard the dawn,
Essence transforms and accumulates,
Changing into an elder,
Head crowned with a plain cap,
Green mantle, crimson skirt,
Right side bearing flowing bells,
Left side girded with the Tiger’s Might,
Hand grasping Heaven’s Steel,
Dispersing blades to fly the celestial bodies,
Feet treading the flowery canopy,
Spewing rays to refine the body,
The Three Effulgences guard and protect,
Enabling me to attain the true,
Nurturing the *po*, restraining the *hun*,
Riding the whirlwind to fly as an immortal."

When finished, swallow saliva three more times and knock the teeth three times.

Those who can practice this method for fifteen years will be met by the Southern Culmen’s Elder of Cinnabar Mound, the Upper Perfected, who will welcome them with a chariot of green clouds; the Western Culmen’s Elder of Plain Clouds, the Master of the Appointed Time, who will welcome them with a carriage of yellow whirlwinds; the Northern Culmen’s Elder of the Dark Prime, the Celestial Sovereign, who will welcome them with a dragon of dark effulgence; the Eastern Culmen’s Elder, the Duke Who Upholds Yang, who will welcome them with a retinue of azure chariots; and the Central Prime’s Elder, the Supreme Dark Child of the Center, who will welcome them with a canopy of curved dawn. The Five Elders will unite and together ascend to the Purple Void.

Practice this without fail, and visualize with precision.

This is the profound spirit of the body’s utmost root, the supreme numen guarding the center. Next visualize it in the form of an infant, seated peacefully in its place.

chunks.original_text: 忌履秽，禁杂处，常熏香，数沐浴。 违之者凋败，顺之者飞仙也。 存星毕，而欲有所愿，在意所祝后，续言之也。 存五星共室止处，直入项下二寸，仍辟方一寸，星如弹丸，照洞面体。 月旦、月望、月七日、月九日、月十三日、月十七日、月二十日、月二十五日，鸡呜时，存日月之象在魂房六合。 魂房六合在两目外之上角小仰高空之中，按之叩齿，闻乎下有四会，动在其下者是也，直入一寸方九分，名曰魂房六合之府。 日左月右，存使光明洞形，令仿髴在位，开目极念，无得遗脱。 毕，叩齿七通，而微祝曰： 大明灵晨，九度郁青，招霞藏晖，灌炼五形，宫驾六合，七神调平，使我飞仙，魂登上清。 毕，行之十五年，玉皇遣三素軿来迎。 子当养能呜鸡，使其司旦而有常节者也。 若隐章而作，必失日月之交晖也。 南极夫人受此术太上高真，名曰双景翼形隐存幽道，审是仙骨者，乃得闻此经目也。 东向太清玄元上三天无极大道、诸君丈人。 西向天师、女师、嗣师、系师三师君。 北向太上老君、太玄上一君、太上丈人。 南向道德君道德丈人、万禄君万福丈人、万生君万生丈人。 上清紫微帝君南极元君玉经宝诀竟
chunks.translated_text:
Avoid treading upon filth, refrain from mingling with the impure, regularly burn incense, and bathe frequently. Those who violate these precepts will wither and decay; those who observe them will ascend as flying immortals.

Once the visualization of the stars is complete and you harbor a wish, express it immediately after your prayer. Envision the Five Stars dwelling together, entering two *cun* below the nape and spreading one *cun* in each direction, each star like a pellet illuminating the body through and through.

On the first, fifteenth, seventh, ninth, thirteenth, seventeenth, twentieth, and twenty-fifth days of the lunar month, at cock’s crow, visualize the images of the sun and moon within the *Hun Chamber of the Six Harmonies*. The *Hun Chamber of the Six Harmonies* lies in the small upward curve above the outer corners of the eyes, within the high void. Press upon it, click the teeth, and listen below—where the four convergences stir beneath is the location. It extends one *cun* inward and spans nine *fen* in width, known as the *Mansion of the Hun Chamber of the Six Harmonies*.

With the sun on the left and the moon on the right, visualize their radiance penetrating the form, ensuring their faint presence in position. Open the eyes and concentrate intensely, allowing no lapse. Upon completion, click the teeth seven times and softly intone:

*"O Radiant Dawn of the Great Clarity,
Ninefold verdant mist ascends,
Summoning rosy clouds to conceal their splendor,
Bathing and refining the Five Forms.
The palace chariot of the Six Harmonies,
The seven spirits in harmonious balance—
Let me ascend as a flying immortal,
My hun-soul mounting the Upper Clarity."*

Practice this for fifteen years, and the Jade Emperor will dispatch the *Three Simplicity Chariots* to welcome you. You must train the cock to crow, ensuring it governs the dawn with regularity. Should you conceal the script and practice in secret, you will surely lose the intertwined radiance of the sun and moon.

The Southern Culmen Lady received this method from the Supreme Lofty Perfected, naming it *The Hidden Way of Dual Radiance and Winged Form*. Only those with true immortal bones may behold this scripture.

Face east toward the *Great Clarity, Primordial Origin, Upper Three Heavens, Boundless Great Dao, and the Venerable Lords of the Multitudes*. Face west toward the *Celestial Masters, Female Masters, Heir Masters, and Lineage Masters—the Three Master Lords*. Face north toward the *Supreme Lord Lao, Supreme Mystery Upper First Lord, and Supreme Venerable Lord*. Face south toward the *Lord of Virtue and the Venerable Lord of Virtue, Lord of Myriad Blessings and the Venerable Lord of Myriad Blessings, Lord of Myriad Lives and the Venerable Lord of Myriad Lives*.

Here ends the *Jade Scripture Precious Formulae of the Upper Clarity Purple Tenuity Emperor and the Southern Culmen Primordial Lord*.
